column4: i wouldn't let partition magic touch anything else than fat or ntfs if you love your data
i'm trying again and it seems to be working. apparently it didn't like ext2ifs.
it's resizing my ext2 partition right now; it's checking for inodes, so it seems at least somewhat aware that data exists on the drive. we'll find out soon whether it makes any effort to keep it.

shouldn't there be a ext[23] resize (something like that) available in ubuntu. I think its default mode is to expand the filesystem to the size of the partition (note: expand only - for shrinking there's more to be done)
